Gory, challenging, satisfying and fun.

Pros:
- Good graphics
- Easy gameplay
- Not so much bullshit, getting right down to shooting waves of zombies.
- Amazing Gore-system
- A wide variety of different enemies, all with their own special design, abilities and weaknesses.
- Fun classes and a good amount of weapons.
- Good shop system and challenging little side-missions.

Cons:
- It can take a long time to level up playing solo.
- Solo can be a little boring after a while.
- All guns are no scope (some of you may think of that as a cons, but in this genre it is fitting)
- Not really any story, just a good zombie-horde slaughter game. Lots of simple fun though!

*Look out for KILLING FLOOR 2! Most advanced gore-system in any game to date!*

I loved it when I could play it, but now I go to launch it and before it starts doing anything, it says it stops working, then when I try to uninstall and reinstall, the install doesnt install anything and the program doesn't exist on my computer. However, I have never heard of this happening anywhere else so you're probably safe to get it.

So, what is so special about yet another zombie horde-mode killathon? Well, to be honest, I forgot I had even bought this game, and it sat in my library for the longest time. Then I played it, and it is a game that I cannot put down.

Individually, the game seems absurdly simply. Graphics are okay, nothing special, controls are simple, weapon choices, while fun at times, are rather linear, but this game takes individual factors that work okay in other games, and mashes them together, making them even better.

Imagine if you will a co-op style horde mode, similar to Left 4 Dead, complete with your basic and advanced hordes, add in class mechanics that improve the usage of certain weapons, but do not limit you in any way (A Sharpshooter is not limited to pistols and rifles, a Commando is not limited to assault rifles), plus some added strategy (Where you make your stand in each wave and where you fortify your defenses can often mean the difference between victory and defeat) and a pretty decent difficulty curve.

The only downside I can think of is that the game is explicitly made to be played multiplayer co-op. I'm no ace, but I'm rather good at FPSs, and I have trouble playing on Normal difficulty alone. I personally don't do matchmaking, because I dislike the idea of having to rely upon a bunch of strangers who I don't know to have some modicum of intelligence and as I don't have a headset, communication would be a problem, but I suspect if I'm able to play this game with some friends, it could be some of the most fun I've had in a while.

Summary Rating: 8/10

There's a lot here, and it's a really fun game, with a lot of different ways to play. You can even switch between roles mid game if you feel a flamethrower might do the job better than an assault rifle, or something like that. My only real problem doesn't have to do with the graphics or anything like that, but a few other gripes, primarily the linearity of gin upgrades in each category, and the multiplayer focused design. Having good multiplayer is outstanding, but making it near impossible to play alone on higher difficulties is kind of a low blow. Anyway, good game, definitely recommend, hope to play with other people in the future.
One of the few games with fluidity; easy to pick up and learn in one match.

A very fun zombie survival game. Definitely worth buying on sale. Its like Nazi Zombies and Left 4 Dead put together. Very fun and hilarious voice acting make "Killing Floor" a must buy!

Killing Floor is a wave defence game with a nightmarish twist.  There's plenty of content for those of you who sell your Steam inventory items (since each one is worth a few bucks at a time) but unless you have that, I feel the game CAN get old fast.  It's casually fun but don't expect new experience each time you play.  The class system makes for subtle differences in playstyle but it all seems to blend together at times.  

The game is fun for hours at a time, then you can go a month before saying "Hey, I want to play KF again."  Which you do, happily.  FPS Wave defences are still fun.

6/10.  The more money you put into the game, the more likely you are to enjoy yourself.  But, you're still going to enjoy yourself without that.  It's a worthy sale pick up and it's a great relaxing shooter to play with your buddies.

Братья и сестры! Вот он! Симулятор Майдана, но не такого майдана, который мы привыкли видеть! Здесь все страшнее! Пресвятой  Янукович спустил своих ангнелов беркутовцев на неразумную толпу дикарей с севера, а европы тут нет... Оу... Мой помошник говорит, что я опять обнюхался кокаина и не понимаю о чем говорю... 
И так, теперь серьёзно. Это очень интересная игра в плане геймплей (кооперативного, одиночная игра ужасно скучна), ибо качественно проработанное оружие и огромные толпы монстров не позволяют вам расслабиться ни на секунду, а это редко увидишь в играх. Так же здесь есть прекрасные православные золотые пушки, что понравится всем попам из Сергиевой лавры, я же знаю как вы любите убивать зомбей... 
Конечно, здесь много раков, но если вам попадется адекватная партия, то... То вы не захотите расстаться с ними никогда... Они будут вам лучшими друзьями! 
Приятной вам игры. 
Пожертвуйте деньги на постройку храма... Рубликов 600... Можно 1000!

This is a really solid game. Teamwork is key, you can take down the boss (known as the Patriarch) with just two well co-ordinated players much more easily than a team of six loners. Weapon choice is key as welland money management is crucial (I.E Do you save up for the chainsaw or spend what money you have on a katana and machete with body armour).
A very solid, entertaining game that will keep you suckd in for very many hours

This is a gem among zombie games, a game where the little details make it all the better. Killing Floor is a game that immerses you and grabs your brain and smothers it into its bosom of gore and pure hectic survival instict. You want a game that'll make you hungering for more brains than a horde could stomach? Well here it is.

Awesome zombie-killin' fun! There is so much fun to be had here! If you enjoy Left 4 Dead or CoD Zombies, then you will love this game! The Zed designs are creative and creepy and the heavy-metal soundtrack is kickass!

The point of the game is killing experimental monsters which takes place over many floors, so you could say the name says it all. But even with its lack of plot, I find Killing Floor to be a fun and challenging game.

   In Killing Floor you play in first person, possibly with friends, fighting nine different kinds of specimens that roam the map looking for people to kill, becoming more numerous and releasing different specimens as the waves go by until waves 10 (if you are playing a full game) you encounter the boss, the Patriarch, who has the combined abilities of all the other specimens. Most of the regular specimen are easy to kill, with either a head shot or a shot close up with a shot gun blast to one shot them, but if someone yells Flesh Pound (FP), get some ground and prepare for a grinder.

   There are seven different classes (called Perks), Field medic, Support specialist, Sharpshooter, Commando, Berserker, Firebug and Demolition which all specialize in different weapons and abilities. Also, The game has a leveling system, which varies between the different perks, mostly based off the weapons use. Such as the Sharpshooter building levels on head shots with pistols, rifles and crossbows. Having a higher level brings down the cost of weapons and increase their efficiency, which makes you start at the lower difficulties to work your way through the level to beat the harder difficulties.

   Over all I love playing Killing Floor with friends and will keep playing for years to come.
